root_causes: Uses SELECT IF without TEMPORARY for QA listings which will permanently filter/drop cases and affect subsequent checks (expected behavior: temporary selection for LIST only).
Per-cell numeric range / DK-vs-numeric checks do not require the comparator S7_4 to be present (NOT MISSING(S7_4)) whereas the expected logic requires per-cell checks only when S7_4 is present.
DK variable name used is B3cDKx4_99 in the script while the expected logic references B3cDKx4 (verify actual DK variable name/suffix); mismatch could cause checks to reference the wrong variable.
instructions: Make QA SELECT IF temporary: precede each SELECT IF used only for listing with TEMPORARY. Example: TEMPORARY. SELECT IF (B3cx4_flag_DKmiss = 1). LIST ... . This prevents permanently excluding cases for later checks.

Add presence check for comparator S7_4 to per-cell numeric and DK-vs-numeric checks. For example, include AND NOT MISSING(S7_4) in the IF conditions used inside the DO REPEAT so per-cell validation only runs when S7_4 exists (matching expected behavior).

Verify the actual DK variable name in the dataset. If the DK indicator is B3cDKx4 (no suffix) adapt checks to use the correct variable. If the DK is stored in a suffix field (e.g. B3cDKx4_99), ensure that is the intended field and document it. Update all references consistently.
After making SELECT IF temporary, ensure subsequent computations (flag creation, SUM and consistency checks) run on the full dataset (or use separate TEMPORARY SELECT IF blocks for each LIST).

Optional: For the 'Other' open-text consistency, ensure you treat the free-text field as the proper type when trimming/checking emptiness (use LTRIM/RTRIM on a string variable directly or convert numeric-to-string only if needed).
